wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Oil ERP Asset Registry and Integrity Tracking System. Explain its purpose as a distributed ERP system for oil industry asset management with multi-plant data collection and centralized analytics. Document the architecture including the central database, plant databases (ANPZ/KRNPZ), and the .NET application layer. Describe the relationship between components and the overall system flow. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Provide practical examples of common use cases such as asset registration, measurement processing, and risk assessment. Document the implementation details including the technology stack (.NET 8, PostgreSQL, Dapper) and deployment topology.

wiki_catalogs.name: Asset Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Asset Management endpoints in the Oil ERP system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for all asset-related operations. Include detailed documentation for GET /api/assets/{assetCode} (retrieve asset details), POST /api/assets (create or update asset), GET /api/assets/plant/{plantCode} (retrieve assets by plant), and related endpoints. For each endpoint, document parameters, return values, error responses (404 Not Found, 400 Bad Request), and provide practical examples using real-world scenarios. Explain the AssetRequest and AssetResponse models, including validation rules and field constraints. Address common issues such as invalid asset codes, missing required fields, and plant code validation. Include guidance on how asset creation triggers downstream processes like risk assessment and measurement tracking.

wiki_catalogs.name: Asset Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Asset entity in the Oil ERP system. Detail field definitions, data types, and business rules such as asset creation, description updates, and relationship management with segments, defects, and work orders. Document primary key (Id), unique constraints (TagNumber), and navigation properties. Explain data validation rules and encapsulated behaviors like HasCriticalDefects() and GetTotalLength(). Include a database schema diagram showing relationships with Segment, Defect, WorkOrder, and Analytics entities. Provide practical examples of how assets are created, updated, and queried in the application, including usage patterns in services and repositories. Address performance considerations for large asset hierarchies and access control for sensitive asset data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Central Database Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the central database schema of the Oil ERP system. Detail entity relationships, table definitions, and column data types in the central database. Explain primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints for each table including central.events_inbox, central.risk_assessments, and central.analytics_summary. Document stored procedures such as sp_ingest_events_legacy and core functions like fn_calculate_corrosion_rate. Include information about data validation rules and business logic enforced at the database level. Provide a schema diagram illustrating relationships between central database tables. Address data security, access control, and retention policies specific to the centralized analytics and risk assessment data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Asset Management Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Asset Management Service component. Thoroughly explain implementation details, including asset creation, update, segment addition, health status evaluation, and utilization metrics calculation. Document the invocation relationships between methods, interfaces, and domain models. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase, such as how unique tag numbers are enforced and how health status is determined based on defects. Explain relationships with other components like UnitOfWork and DefectRepository. Address common issues such as duplicate tag numbers or invalid segment positioning, and provide solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding validation logic and business rules.

wiki_catalogs.name: Unit Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the unit testing strategy in the Oil ERP system. Thoroughly explain the implementation of unit tests for core business logic in the AssetService and MeasurementService classes. Document the use of Moq for mocking dependencies such as IUnitOfWork and repository interfaces to isolate business logic. Include concrete examples from AssetServiceTests and MeasurementServiceTests, showing test setup patterns, assertion strategies, and validation of service behavior. Explain how test cases cover success scenarios, validation rules, and error conditions such as duplicate asset creation or invalid measurement data. Address common issues like proper mock configuration and ensuring test determinism. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the plant database schema structure used in both ANPZ and KRNPZ databases. Detail the entity relationships and table definitions for assets_local, measurement_points, measurements, and local_events tables. Explain primary keys, foreign key constraints, unique indexes, and check constraints for data integrity. Document the purpose of each column including data types and default values. Highlight the use of GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY for auto-incrementing IDs and the role of indexes in query performance. Include a schema diagram showing relationships between tables and emphasize the local nature of this data before synchronization. Provide examples of common queries for retrieving asset measurements and explain how the schema supports batch processing workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up and running the Oil ERP system. Explain the prerequisites including .NET 8 SDK, PostgreSQL 14+, and Git. Document the step-by-step process for building the solution using 'dotnet restore' and 'dotnet build' commands. Include instructions for running tests, the console application, and the desktop UI. Provide detailed database setup instructions including creating the central database (oil_erp_central) and plant databases (oil_erp_anpz, oil_erp_krnpz), and executing SQL scripts in the correct order. Include configuration instructions for updating appsettings.json with database connection strings. Provide practical examples of running the application and accessing the API endpoints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Measurement Operations API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Measurement Operations endpoints in the Oil ERP system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for measurement submission and retrieval. Include detailed documentation for POST /api/measurements/batch (submit batch of measurements), GET /api/measurements/{assetCode} (retrieve measurement history), GET /api/measurements/{assetCode}/latest (retrieve latest measurements), and GET /api/measurements/corrosion-rate (calculate corrosion rate). For each endpoint, document parameters, return values, error responses, and provide practical examples showing valid and invalid measurement submissions. Explain the BatchMeasurementRequest and MeasurementHistoryResponse models, including validation rules for thickness values and timestamps. Address common issues such as invalid measurement data, missing asset references, and date range errors. Include performance considerations for handling large measurement batches and best practices for timestamp accuracy.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reading Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Reading entity in the Oil ERP system. Detail field definitions including Id, PointId, Value, Unit, MeasuredAt, and validity status. Document primary key (Id), foreign key (PointId), and indexing considerations for time-series data retrieval. Explain business methods such as IsOutOfRange(), MarkAsInvalid(), and GetFormattedValue(). Include data validation rules and state management for reading validity. Provide a schema diagram showing the relationship with MeasurementPoint. Offer practical examples of how readings are submitted in batches, validated, and analyzed for corrosion trends. Discuss performance optimization for high-frequency measurement ingestion and querying. Address data retention policies and archival strategies for historical measurement data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Plant Databases Schema (ANPZ & KRNPZ)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the plant database schemas (ANPZ and KRNPZ) of the Oil ERP system. Detail entity relationships, table definitions, and column data types for asset, measurement, and work order tables in plant databases. Explain primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints for tables such as plant.assets, plant.measurements, and plant.work_orders. Document the trigger logic in trigger_measurements_ai that activates on measurement insertion. Describe the stored procedures including sp_insert_measurement_batch and wrapper procedures for batch processing. Explain the Foreign Data Wrapper (FDW) configuration that enables cross-database communication with the central database. Include schema diagrams for both ANPZ and KRNPZ databases and highlight their identical structure. Address data security, local validation rules, and synchronization mechanisms with the central system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Measurement Processing Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Measurement Processing Service component. Thoroughly explain implementation details including reading validation, anomaly detection, trend analysis, and threshold monitoring. Document the invocation relationships between methods, interfaces, and domain models. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase, such as how wall thickness readings are validated and how standard deviation is used to detect anomalies. Explain relationships with MeasurementPoint and Reading entities. Address common issues like invalid measurement values or unexpected trends, and provide solutions. Cover performance considerations for processing large volumes of readings and optimization tips for trend calculations. Make content accessible to beginners while providing technical depth on statistical methods used in anomaly detection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the integration testing approach in the Oil ERP system. Thoroughly explain how TestContainers is used to spin up isolated PostgreSQL instances for realistic database testing. Document the implementation of DatabaseIntegrationTests, including container setup, schema initialization, and service registration via dependency injection. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how repositories like RiskAssessmentRepository and CorrosionAnalyticsRepository are tested against a real database. Explain how test data is seeded and verified across multiple integration scenarios. Address common issues such as container startup failures, connection timeouts, and transaction isolation. Provide guidance on test performance optimization and parallel execution considerations. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Foreign Data Wrapper (FDW) Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Foreign Data Wrapper (FDW) configuration that enables secure cross-database communication between plant databases (ANPZ/KRNPZ) and the central database. Explain the creation of the postgres_fdw extension, server definition for central_srv, and user mapping for secure authentication. Document the purpose of the central_ft schema and the foreign table events_inbox that maps to the central database's public.events_inbox. Describe how connection options like host, dbname, and port are configured and how user mappings handle credentials securely. Include security considerations for avoiding hardcoded passwords and using session user mappings. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common FDW issues such as connectivity failures, permission errors, and schema synchronization problems. Explain how this setup enables event-driven architecture by allowing local databases to push events to the central system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack & Dependencies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack and dependencies of the Oil ERP system. Explain the purpose and role of each technology in the architecture. Document .NET 8 as the core framework providing the runtime and libraries, PostgreSQL as the database engine with FDW for distributed operations, Dapper as the micro ORM for efficient database access, ASP.NET Core for the REST API framework, Serilog for structured logging, FluentValidation for input validation, xUnit for testing, and TestContainers for integration testing. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Provide practical examples of how these technologies work together in the system. Document configuration options and usage patterns for each component.

wiki_catalogs.name: Analytics & Reporting API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Analytics & Reporting endpoints in the Oil ERP system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for all analytics endpoints. Include detailed documentation for GET /api/analytics/top-risk (retrieve top risk assets), GET /api/analytics/summary (system analytics summary), GET /api/analytics/risk-level/{riskLevel} (assets by risk level), GET /api/analytics/corrosion (corrosion analytics), and POST/GET /api/analytics/risk-policies (manage risk policies). For each endpoint, document parameters, return values, error responses, and provide practical examples showing how to retrieve risk assessments and system metrics. Explain the TopRiskAssetsResponse, AnalyticsSummaryResponse, and RiskPolicyResponse models, including their data structure and usage. Address common issues such as invalid risk levels, rate limiting considerations, and handling of placeholder implementations. Include guidance on how analytics data is derived from measurements and risk assessments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Measurement Point Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the MeasurementPoint entity in the Oil ERP system. Detail field definitions including Id, SegmentId, PointName, DistanceFromStart, and MeasurementType. Document primary key (Id), foreign key (SegmentId), and constraints such as DistanceFromStart not exceeding segment length. Explain business methods like AddReading(), GetLatestReading(), and GetAverageReading(). Include data validation rules and encapsulated logic for measurement point positioning and type management. Provide a schema diagram showing relationships with Segment and Reading entities. Offer practical examples of how measurement points are configured on assets and used in data collection workflows. Discuss performance considerations for reading aggregation and indexing strategies for time-series queries. Address use cases in risk assessment and corrosion analytics.

wiki_catalogs.name: Risk Assessment Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Risk Assessment Service component. Thoroughly explain implementation details of risk scoring algorithms that combine defect severity, measurement thresholds, and maintenance history. Document the invocation relationships between AssessAssetRiskAsync and its supporting methods for defect, measurement, and maintenance risk assessment. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how risk scores are weighted by severity and how overall risk levels are determined. Explain relationships with MeasurementService and domain entities like RiskFactor and RiskThreshold. Address common issues such as incomplete data affecting risk scores and provide solutions. Include performance considerations for calculating risk across multiple assets and optimization strategies. Make content accessible to beginners while providing deep technical insight into the risk calculation methodology.

wiki_catalogs.name: End-to-End Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the end-to-end testing strategy in the Oil ERP system. Thoroughly explain the purpose and implementation of SystemValidationTests, which validate the complete system composition and configuration. Document how these tests verify proper service registration in the DI container, correct connection string configuration, API model validation attributes, and interface contract integrity. Include concrete examples from the codebase demonstrating structural validation of controllers, domain entities, and value objects. Explain how these tests ensure system-wide consistency without executing actual business workflows. Address common issues such as missing service registrations, configuration mismatches, and assembly loading problems. Provide guidance on extending these tests to cover additional architectural constraints. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Triggers and Event Capture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the trg_measurements_ai trigger and its associated function trg_measurements_ai_fn that automatically capture measurement insertions in the plant databases. Explain the AFTER INSERT trigger timing and row-level execution context. Document how the trigger function constructs a JSONB payload containing point_id, timestamp, and thickness values and inserts them into the local_events table with event_type 'MEAS_INSERT'. Describe the purpose of this event logging for audit trails, debugging, and potential local analytics. Include examples of querying the local_events table to trace measurement history. Address common issues such as trigger performance impact on bulk inserts and strategies for managing event log growth. Explain how this local eventing complements the central eventing system through the batch insertion process.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Oil ERP system's RESTful API endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods for all endpoints. Include detailed documentation for Asset Management endpoints (GET/POST /api/assets), Measurement Operations (POST /api/measurements/batch, GET /api/measurements/{assetCode}), Analytics & Reporting (GET /api/analytics/top-risk, GET /api/analytics/summary), and Work Order Management (POST /api/work-orders, GET /api/work-orders/{id}). For each endpoint, document parameters, return values, error responses, and provide practical examples. Include information about the standardized API response format with success, data, message, and errors fields. Address common issues and their solutions, such as validation errors and resource not found scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Work Order Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Work Order Management endpoints in the Oil ERP system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for all work order operations. Include detailed documentation for POST /api/work-orders (create work order), GET /api/work-orders/{id} (retrieve work order by ID), GET /api/work-orders/asset/{assetCode} (retrieve work orders by asset), GET /api/work-orders/overdue (retrieve overdue work orders), GET /api/work-orders/status/{status} (retrieve by status), PATCH /api/work-orders/{id}/complete (complete work order), and PATCH /api/work-orders/{id}/assign (assign work order). For each endpoint, document parameters, return values, error responses, and provide practical examples showing complete work order lifecycle management. Explain the WorkOrderRequest and WorkOrderResponse models, including validation rules and status transitions. Address common issues such as invalid work order IDs, missing completion notes, and assignment conflicts. Include guidance on how work orders integrate with asset risk assessments and maintenance workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Segment Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Segment entity in the Oil ERP system. Detail field definitions including Id, AssetId, SegmentName, LengthM, MaterialCode, and CoatingCode. Document primary key (Id), foreign key (AssetId), and constraints such as positive length validation. Explain business methods like AddMeasurementPoint(), UpdateLength(), and GetMeasurementPointsByType(). Include data validation rules and encapsulated logic for structural integrity checks. Provide a schema diagram showing relationships with Asset and MeasurementPoint entities. Offer practical examples of how segments are used to model pipeline sections and equipment components. Discuss performance considerations for hierarchical asset traversal and aggregation of measurement data across segments. Address use cases in corrosion rate calculation and risk assessment.

wiki_catalogs.name: Work Order Management Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Work Order Management Service component. Thoroughly explain implementation details including work order creation, defect-to-work-order conversion, preventive maintenance scheduling, and workload recommendations. Document the invocation relationships between methods, interfaces, and domain models. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase, such as how work order numbers are generated uniquely and how scheduling priorities are determined based on defect severity. Explain relationships with Asset, Defect, and WorkOrder entities. Address common issues like scheduling conflicts or priority misalignment, and provide solutions. Cover performance considerations for bulk scheduling and optimization tips for workload distribution. Make content accessible to beginners while providing technical depth on scheduling algorithms and business logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Stored Procedures for Batch Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the sp_insert_measurement_batch function that handles bulk measurement data ingestion in plant databases. Detail the input parameters: p_asset_code (TEXT), p_points (JSONB array), and p_source_plant (TEXT). Explain the function's logic for asset lookup/creation, measurement point registration, and bulk measurement insertion with proper error handling for invalid inputs. Document how the function calculates first and last thickness measurements and timestamps to compute corrosion rates. Describe the critical integration point where successful batch insertion triggers an event in central_ft.events_inbox with payload containing asset metrics and source plant information. Include examples of calling the function with sample JSONB data and explain return value semantics (number of inserted rows). Address performance considerations for large batches and transaction isolation behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models & ORM Mapping
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the core entities in the Oil ERP system. Detail entity relationships, field definitions, and data types for Asset, Reading, MeasurementPoint, Segment, Defect, WorkOrder, and Analytics entities. Document primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints. Explain data validation rules and business rules implemented in the entities. Include database schema diagrams and sample data for each entity. Document data access patterns, caching strategies, and performance considerations. Specify data lifecycle, retention policies, and archival rules. Address data security, privacy requirements, and access control for sensitive information. Provide practical examples of how these models are used in the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Defect Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Defect entity in the Oil ERP system. Detail field definitions including Id, AssetId, DefectType, Severity, DiscoveredAt, and resolution status. Document primary key (Id), foreign key (AssetId), and constraints such as severity level validation. Explain business methods like Resolve(), Reopen(), and IsCritical(). Include data validation rules and state transitions for defect lifecycle management. Provide a schema diagram showing relationships with Asset and WorkOrder entities. Offer practical examples of how defects are discovered during inspections and linked to maintenance activities. Discuss performance considerations for querying active defects and aggregating defect statistics for risk scoring. Address integration with work order management and analytics reporting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Wrapper Procedures
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the purpose and implementation of the sp_insert_measurement_batch_prc wrapper procedure that provides a procedural interface to the sp_insert_measurement_batch function. Explain why a wrapper procedure is used instead of direct function calls, including compatibility with certain client drivers that prefer CALL syntax over SELECT. Describe how the wrapper simply invokes the core function using PERFORM and discards the return value, making it suitable for fire-and-forget scenarios. Highlight the identical structure across ANPZ and KRNPZ databases and how this ensures consistent API behavior across plants. Provide usage examples using the CALL statement and compare it with direct function invocation. Address when to use the function versus the procedure based on client requirements and return value needs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Business Logic Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the business logic layer of the Oil ERP system. Describe the high-level design using Domain-Driven Design principles with rich domain entities and services. Document the architectural patterns including the Repository Pattern for clean separation of data access concerns and Dependency Injection for service composition. Explain component interactions, data flows, and integration patterns between services. Detail technical decisions, trade-offs, and constraints in the implementation. Include infrastructure requirements, scalability considerations, and deployment topology. Provide system context diagrams and component breakdowns. Address cross-cutting concerns like security, monitoring, and error handling. Document the technology stack and third-party dependencies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Work Order Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the WorkOrder entity in the Oil ERP system. Detail field definitions including Id, AssetId, WoNumber, Status, ScheduledDate, and completion metrics. Document primary key (Id), foreign keys (AssetId, DefectId), and constraints such as status transition rules. Explain business methods like Start(), Complete(), and IsOverdue(). Include data validation rules and state machine logic for work order lifecycle management. Provide a schema diagram showing relationships with Asset and Defect entities. Offer practical examples of how work orders are created for preventive maintenance and corrective actions. Discuss performance considerations for scheduling queries and overdue work order detection. Address integration with defect resolution and analytics for maintenance performance tracking.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the database schema of the Oil ERP system. Detail the structure of the central database and plant databases (ANPZ/KRNPZ). Document entity relationships, table definitions, and column data types. Explain primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints for each table. Include database schema diagrams showing the relationships between tables in the central and plant databases. Document stored procedures, functions, and triggers implemented in the SQL scripts. Explain data validation rules and business rules enforced at the database level. Provide information about the Foreign Data Wrapper (FDW) setup for cross-database communication. Address data security, privacy requirements, and access control at the database level.

wiki_catalogs.name: Analytics Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Analytics entities in the Oil ERP system, including RiskAssessment and CorrosionAnalytics. Detail field definitions for risk scoring components, corrosion rate calculations, and remaining life estimates. Document relationships with Asset through navigation properties. Explain business rules for risk level determination based on policy thresholds and historical data trends. Include schema diagrams for analytics-specific tables such as corrosion_rates and remaining_life. Provide practical examples of how analytics data is generated from measurements and used in risk assessment workflows. Discuss performance considerations for analytical queries on large datasets and indexing strategies for time-series trend analysis. Address data retention policies for historical analytics and integration with reporting dashboards.

wiki_catalogs.name: System Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Oil ERP system. Describe the high-level design with distributed architecture featuring central and plant databases. Document the architectural patterns including Domain-Driven Design with aggregate roots (Asset), value objects, and domain services. Explain the Repository Pattern implementation with interface segregation and unit of work for transaction management. Detail component interactions, data flows, and integration patterns between the application layer, domain layer, and data access layer. Explain technical decisions, trade-offs, and constraints in choosing this architecture. Include infrastructure requirements, scalability considerations, and deployment topology. Provide system context diagrams and component breakdowns. Address cross-cutting concerns like security, monitoring, and disaster recovery. Document technology stack, third-party dependencies, and version compatibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on deploying the Oil ERP system. Explain the configuration options available in appsettings.json and appsettings.Development.json, including connection strings for central, ANPZ, and KRNPZ databases. Document the structure of the configuration files and how they are used in different environments. Provide detailed instructions for setting up production, staging, and development environments. Include information about environment-specific configuration and how to manage secrets securely. Document the application startup process in Program.cs, including service registration, middleware configuration, and dependency injection setup. Provide practical examples of deployment scenarios and common issues with their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the testing strategy of the Oil ERP system. Explain the different types of tests implemented: unit tests for business logic validation, integration tests for database operations with TestContainers, and end-to-end tests for full system validation. Document the test categories and their purposes, including fast isolated tests for business logic, database operations with real PostgreSQL, and system validation tests. Explain the test data management approach using TestContainers for isolated database instances, fixtures for reusable test data, and mocking for service isolation. Provide practical examples of test implementations and common testing patterns used in the codebase. Include information about running tests with different filters and ensuring test coverage.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: OilERP Distributed System

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The OilERP project is a distributed ERP system designed for oil industry asset management, focusing on multi-plant data collection, centralized analytics, and risk assessment capabilities. The system enables comprehensive monitoring of pipeline assets across multiple plants with centralized risk evaluation and maintenance planning.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Implement a distributed architecture for collecting measurement data from multiple oil plants (ANPZ and KRNPZ)
- Provide centralized analytics and risk assessment capabilities
- Enable efficient asset management and work order tracking
- Ensure data consistency across distributed databases using PostgreSQL FDW (Foreign Data Wrapper)
- Support batch processing of measurement data with automated risk assessment

### Target Audience
- Oil and gas industry operators managing pipeline infrastructure
- Maintenance and inspection teams requiring asset health information
- Plant managers needing risk assessment and analytics
- System administrators responsible for maintaining the ERP infrastructure

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a clean, layered architecture with distinct separation of concerns:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
    B --> C[Business Logic]
    C --> D[Data Access]
    D --> E[(Central Database)]
    D --> F[(ANPZ Database)]
    D --> G[(KRNPZ Database)]
    H[SQL Scripts] --> E
    H --> F
    H --> G
```

### Design Patterns
The system implements several key design patterns:

- **Domain-Driven Design**: Rich domain entities with business logic encapsulated in entities and services
- **Repository Pattern**: Clean separation between business logic and data access concerns
- **Dependency Injection**: Service registration and resolution through .NET's built-in DI container
- **Layered Architecture**: Clear separation between presentation, business logic, and data access layers
- **API Gateway Pattern**: REST API serving as the entry point for all client interactions

### System Relationships
The architecture consists of multiple interconnected components:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[OilErp.App] --> B[OilErp.Domain]
    A --> C[OilErp.Data]
    B --> C
    C --> D[Central Database]
    C --> E[ANPZ Database]
    C --> F[KRNPZ Database]
    G[SQL Scripts] --> D
    G --> E
    G --> F
    A --> H[Swagger UI]
    I[Client Applications] --> A
```

### Data Flow
The system processes data through a well-defined flow:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Measurement Submission] --> B[Plant Database]
    B --> C[Trigger Activation]
    C --> D[Event Publishing]
    D --> E[Central Events Inbox]
    E --> F[Analytics Processing]
    F --> G[Risk Assessment]
    G --> H[Reporting & Visualization]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Program.cs**: Application startup and configuration
- **Controllers**: REST API endpoints for various operations

Sources:
- [Program.cs](src/OilErp.App/Program.cs)
- [AssetsController.cs](src/OilErp.App/Controllers/AssetsController.cs)
- [MeasurementsController.cs](src/OilErp.App/Controllers/MeasurementsController.cs)
- [WorkOrdersController.cs](src/OilErp.App/Controllers/WorkOrdersController.cs)

### Core Modules
- **Domain Layer**: Business entities, value objects, and service interfaces
- **Data Access Layer**: Repository implementations and database infrastructure
- **Application Layer**: API controllers and request/response models

Sources:
- [Asset.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/Asset.cs)
- [Reading.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/Reading.cs)
- [MeasurementPoint.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/MeasurementPoint.cs)
- [DatabaseInfrastructure.cs](src/OilErp.Data/Infrastructure/DatabaseInfrastructure.cs)

### Configuration Approach
The system uses standard .NET configuration patterns with environment-specific settings:

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[appsettings.json] --> B[Connection Strings]
    A --> C[Serilog Configuration]
    D[appsettings.Development.json] --> B
    D --> C
    E[Program.cs] --> F[Service Registration]
    F --> G[Database Connection Factory]
    G --> H[Configuration]
```

Sources:
- [Program.cs](src/OilErp.App/Program.cs)
- [appsettings.json](src/OilErp.App/appsettings.json)
- [appsettings.Development.json](src/OilErp.App/appsettings.Development.json)

### External Dependencies
The project relies on several key external packages:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[OilERP] --> B[.NET 8.0]
    A --> C[PostgreSQL]
    A --> D[Dapper]
    A --> E[Serilog]
    A --> F[FluentValidation]
    A --> G[xUnit]
    A --> H[TestContainers]
```

Sources:
- [Program.cs](src/OilErp.App/Program.cs)
- [DatabaseInfrastructure.cs](src/OilErp.Data/Infrastructure/DatabaseInfrastructure.cs)

### Integration Points
The system integrates with multiple databases and external systems:

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[OilERP Application] --> B[Central Database]
    A --> C[ANPZ Plant Database]
    A --> D[KRNPZ Plant Database]
    B --> E[FDW Integration]
    C --> E
    D --> E
    A --> F[Swagger UI]
    A --> G[Serilog]
```

Sources:
- [DatabaseInfrastructure.cs](src/OilErp.Data/Infrastructure/DatabaseInfrastructure.cs)
- [IRepositories.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Interfaces/IRepositories.cs)
- [IServices.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Interfaces/IServices.cs)

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The system provides comprehensive functionality for oil industry asset management:

- **Asset Management**: Create, update, and retrieve asset information
- **Measurement Processing**: Submit and analyze measurement data
- **Risk Assessment**: Evaluate asset risk based on measurements and policies
- **Work Order Management**: Track maintenance and repair activities
- **Analytics and Reporting**: Generate insights from collected data

### Implementation Highlights
The system implements several sophisticated features:

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> ProcessingMeasurement: Measurement Batch Submitted
    ProcessingMeasurement --> ValidatingData: Validate Readings
    ValidatingData --> StoringData: Store in Plant DB
    StoringData --> PublishingEvent: Publish Event
    PublishingEvent --> CentralProcessing: Process in Central DB
    CentralProcessing --> CalculatingRisk: Calculate Corrosion Rate
    CalculatingRisk --> AssessingRisk: Evaluate Risk Level
    AssessingRisk --> GeneratingReport: Generate Analytics
    GeneratingReport --> Idle: Complete
```

Sources:
- [AssetsController.cs](src/OilErp.App/Controllers/AssetsController.cs)
- [IRepositories.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Interfaces/IRepositories.cs)
- [IServices.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Interfaces/IServices.cs)
- [DatabaseInfrastructure.cs](src/OilErp.Data/Infrastructure/DatabaseInfrastructure.cs)

### Feature Architecture
The architecture supports key features through well-defined components:

```mermaid
classDiagram
    class Asset {
        +string Id
        +string TagNumber
        +string PlantCode
        +DateTime CreatedAt
        +DateTime UpdatedAt
        +ICollection~Segment~ Segments
        +ICollection~Defect~ Defects
        +ICollection~WorkOrder~ WorkOrders
    }
    
    class Reading {
        +Guid Id
        +Guid PointId
        +decimal Value
        +string Unit
        +DateTime MeasuredAt
        +bool IsValid
    }
    
    class MeasurementPoint {
        +Guid Id
        +Guid SegmentId
        +string PointName
        +decimal DistanceFromStart
        +string MeasurementType
    }
    
    class Segment {
        +Guid Id
        +string AssetId
        +string SegmentName
        +decimal LengthM
        +string MaterialCode
        +string CoatingCode
    }
    
    class Defect {
        +Guid Id
        +string AssetId
        +string DefectType
        +string Severity
        +DateTime DiscoveredAt
        +bool IsResolved
    }
    
    class WorkOrder {
        +Guid Id
        +string AssetId
        +string WoNumber
        +string Status
        +DateTime ScheduledDate
        +string Priority
    }
    
    Asset "1" *-- "0..*" Segment
    Segment "1" *-- "0..*" MeasurementPoint
    MeasurementPoint "1" *-- "0..*" Reading
    Asset "1" *-- "0..*" Defect
    Asset "1" *-- "0..*" WorkOrder
    Defect "1" -- "0..*" WorkOrder
```

Sources:
- [Asset.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/Asset.cs)
- [Reading.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/Reading.cs)
- [MeasurementPoint.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/MeasurementPoint.cs)
- [Segment.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/Segment.cs)
- [Defect.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/Defect.cs)
- [WorkOrder.cs](src/OilErp.Domain/Entities/WorkOrder.cs)
</blog>
